meanings.definition: An experiment conducted before the main experiment to test procedures or equipment.
meanings.sent1: Before the big test, the students did a preexperiment to make sure everything worked.
meanings.sent2: Scientists always do a preexperiment to check if their equipment is functioning correctly.
meanings.sent3: The preexperiment showed that the lab rats were more interested in the food than the maze.
meanings.sent4: The preexperiment with the new telescope revealed hidden stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The preexperiment was like a dress rehearsal before the actual performance.

meanings.definition: To conduct a preliminary experiment before the main experiment.
meanings.sent1: The researchers decided to preexperiment with different variables to see which one worked best.
meanings.sent2: Before launching the rocket, they needed to preexperiment to avoid any errors.
meanings.sent3: The students preexperimented with mixing colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent4: She liked to preexperiment with new recipes before cooking for guests.
meanings.sent5: The chef preexperimented with spices to enhance the flavor of the dish.
